Albania: The Ottoman Sublime Porte divided Albanian-populated lands into the Ottoman-administered vilayets of Janina and Rumelia.
Australia:
John Batman and John Pascoe Fawkner established a settlement at Port Phillip, now the city of Melbourne.
William Wentworth established Australian Patriotic Association, Australia's first political party, to demand democracy for New South Wales.
Brazil:
Malê revolt in Salvador.
Ragamuffin War begins in Rio Grande do Sul.
Chile: Southern Chile is affected by the worst earthquake for several decades on 20 February, an event witnessed by Charles Darwin. Darwin visits Valdivia, Concepción and Mendoza.
Colombia: Start the Colombian coffee industry with the first commercial crops in Norte de Santander
France: The Fieschi attentat: In Paris, the assassination of Louis Philippe I is attempted by Giuseppe Marco Fieschi using a home-made volley gun. Eighteen are killed but the King escapes with a minor wound.
Malta: Malta was granted a Constitution providing for a Council of Government of seven members of whom three were to be nominated Maltese representatives.
Philippine: Pedro Antonio Salazar Castillo y Varona appointed Governor-General (1835)
